meanings.definition: To make something impure or unsuitable for use by introducing or allowing the presence of a harmful substance again.
meanings.sent1: After the spill, the water was recontaminated by the toxic chemicals.
meanings.sent2: The clean room was recontaminated when someone accidentally brought in dirt from outside.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to make a perfect dish was ruined when the sauce was recontaminated with a dash of salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful atmosphere of the park was recontaminated by the loud construction noise nearby.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment was recontaminated by a tiny drop of bacteria, causing the results to be unreliable.

meanings.definition: To cause something to become contaminated again after it has been cleaned or purified.
meanings.sent1: The hospital room was recontaminated when a sick patient unknowingly spread germs around.
meanings.sent2: Despite the thorough cleaning, the kitchen was recontaminated due to improper food handling.
meanings.sent3: The detective's crime scene investigation was recontaminated when the curious cat walked through the area, leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The freshly washed laundry was recontaminated by a muddy paw print from the playful puppy.
meanings.sent5: The air in the sealed container was recontaminated when a tiny hole allowed dust particles to enter, spoiling the experiment.
